main event: A civilian in Huron, Ohio, observed a round, silver object flying east for two minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a silver dollar held at arm's length.
No radar contact was made with the object.
Ground observer used binoculars of unknown power to observe the object.
The reporting authority believed the object was a weather or MKE balloon.
The conclusion of the headquarters was that this sighting was a PROBABLE BALLOON.
